lines.text: Terry, will you stop being a doctor first and a woman second?
He's afraid of losing his patients to modern medicine. He wants to keep them steeped in their centuries-old superstitions. They worship him like some kind of high priest!
Back in the States they don't regard doctors that way. Sometimes they don't even pay their bills!
You better lay off that stuff, Professor. You'll wake up in the morning with a hangover, but the drums will still be here.
The drums don't bother me, Doc. As a matter of fact, they have a nice anthropological beat.
Well, maybe we ought to record it, get it on the hit parade!
If you didn't want me to kiss you, why did you kiss me back?
I don't know. Maybe it's my metabolism
You know, I have a eerie feeling... it can hear what we are saying.
We kill Tubanga, then the Americans.
